infos.info: A 145-foot-high monument, bearing a statue of Lord Horatio Nelson guarded by lions, marks the spot considered the center of London.

commentList.name: Smith
commentList.content: We stayed just around the corner so were fortunate to visit here many times on our visit. We sat in a cafe watching the square wake up one chilly morning. Another time we visited the gallery when it was raining  and watched people struggle in the wind with their umbrellas lol. Meandered through on our travels. Love the vibe.,

commentList.name: Claire
commentList.content: The square was buzzing with activity. Lots of tourist, especially hanging out by the water fountain. Many top attractions fronting on the square and nearby. Majestic buildings and stately architecture.

commentList.name: Richard
commentList.content: A relaxing walk in Trafalgar Square with friends is all you could want. Once you reach the statue guarded by lions, you can consider that you are in the heart of London.
